description:
For file-based volume drivers (eg; GlusterFS) that uses qcow2  snapshotting mechanism doesn't use relative path post an online snap delete operation.

In my testing with GlusterFS , I see 2 scenarios where the backing file path was using nova mnt instead of relative path.
eg: /opt/stack/data/nova/mnt/f4c6ad7e3bba4ad1195b3b538efab64a/volume-518a8faa-f264-4c07-80d7-ff691278b5da.838a5847-cb90-4279-b50f-f8f995321665

This is incorrect since after the volume is detach, the above path is invalid on the cinder/storage node.

The 2 scenarios are blockCommit and blockRebase for file-based volume drivers.
title: backing file path isn't relative path for file-based volume drivers using qcow2 snapshots

comments.content:
Adding some debug data and steps.

*** For older libvirt (pre-1.2.7, which does not support _RELATIVE flag)  ***

libvirtd version 1.2.2

stack@ubuntu:~/data/cinder/mnt/f4c6ad7e3bba4ad1195b3b538efab64a$ libvirtd --version libvirtd (libvirt) 1.2.2

Steps:

1) Snap chain : base <- snap1 <- snap2 (snap2: active) (NOTE: All paths during snap create are relative)

2) Deleted snap1 (this causes nova to do a block Commit op)

3) Snap chain: base <- snap2 (snap2: active)

4) Dumping snap2's backing chain, we see the nova mount abs path being used as below:

stack@ubuntu:~/data/cinder/mnt/f4c6ad7e3bba4ad1195b3b538efab64a$ qemu-img info volume-de05536f-fcec-4c42-9bbb-81806632fee9.8ccadd25-dea1-4dff-9a02-83076e748599 --backing-chain
image: volume-de05536f-fcec-4c42-9bbb-81806632fee9.8ccadd25-dea1-4dff-9a02-83076e748599
file format: qcow2
virtual size: 1.0G (1073741824 bytes)
disk size: 193K
cluster_size: 65536
backing file: /opt/stack/data/nova/mnt/f4c6ad7e3bba4ad1195b3b538efab64a/volume-de05536f-fcec-4c42-9bbb-81806632fee9
backing file format: raw
Format specific information:
compat: 1.1
lazy refcounts: false

image: /opt/stack/data/nova/mnt/f4c6ad7e3bba4ad1195b3b538efab64a/volume-de05536f-fcec-4c42-9bbb-81806632fee9 file format: raw virtual size: 1.0G (1073741824 bytes) disk size: 0

5) Go back to step 1: base <- snap1 <- snap2 (snap2: active) (NOTE: All paths during snap create are relative) 6) Deleted snap2 (this causes nova to do a block Rebase (aka pull) op) 7) Snap chain: base <- snap2 (snap2: active) 8) Dumping snap2's backing chain, we see the relative path being used as below:

stack@ubuntu:~/data/cinder/mnt/f4c6ad7e3bba4ad1195b3b538efab64a$ qemu-img info volume-36774096-9d8a-4657-9cba-219dd7dbacb3.98d00fda-9241-4974-8c40-9ff825c69c99 --backing-chain

virtual size: 1.0G (1073741824 bytes)
disk size: 193K
cluster_size: 65536
backing file: volume-36774096-9d8a-4657-9cba-219dd7dbacb3
backing file format: raw
Format specific information:
compat: 1.1
lazy refcounts: false

image: volume-36774096-9d8a-4657-9cba-219dd7dbacb3 file format: raw virtual size: 1.0G (1073741824 bytes) disk size: 0

Conclusion
So it looks like pre-1.2.7 version of libvirt, blockRebase retained the relative path but blockCommit did not.

*** For newer libvirt (post-1.2.7, which supports _RELATIVE flag)  ***

libvirtd version 1.2.9 on F21

I see the same behaviour as for pre-1.2.7 case, since the _RELATIVE flag is used if available only during blockCommit of
network disks and never used for file-type disks, hence we still see the absolute paths for this scenario too

** Patch ***
posted @ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/168805/
fixes the issue for both file and network type disks and takes care of the pre and post libvirt versions

comments.content:
Per comments recd. in the patch @ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/168805/, moving the patch's commit message to the bug here

libvirt added support for _RELATIVE flag in v1.2.7 and when available this
flag _must_ be used to ensure backing paths are maintained relative during
snapshot delete operations.

Per the experiments I did using pre-1.2.7 (v1.2.2) and post-1.2.7 (v1.2.9)
my findings are below:

pre-1.2.7 (eg: v1.2.2) behaviour:
    backing paths are maintained relative for blockRebase but not for
blockCommit operations. Per the libvirt folks, this is not by design,
but a side effect of how/when the snap chain was created. For the Cinder-Nova
online snapshot case, it's broken for sure.

post-1.2.7 (eg: v.1.2.9) behaviour:
    Although the pre-1.2.7 behaviour is seen in this case too, per the
libvirt folks, _RELATIVE flag _must_ be used to guarantee qemu maintains
relative backing paths.

Without this patch:
    _RELATIVE flag was used only for blockCommit of a network disk and
raises excp if this flag isn't present. For file-backed disks case, Cinder
is broken as qemu can't maintain relative paths.

    For blockRebase this flag is never used, probably because blockRebase
maintained relative path (see above) even before this flag came into existence.

With this patch:
    _RELATIVE flag if available, is used for both blockCommit & blockRebase
cases for both file and network backed disks.

    If unavailable, it means we are dealing with pre-1.2.7 libvirt, and
it raises excp for blockCommit case (since we can't get relative paths and
Cinder flow is broken), but only puts out a warning message for blockRebase
case (since relative paths works even for older libvirt)

Summary:
    1) Uses _RELATIVE for blockRebase if available, for both file and network
       disks. Don't raise excp if flag isn't present, thus preserving older
       behaviour.

    2) Uses _RELATIVE for blockCommit if available, for both file and network
       disks. Raise excp if flag isn't present to ensure Cinder flow isn't
       broken (old behaviour changes here, for file backed disks only)

commit 7458c85daaffc56199094f66f29b2b86a4725955
Author: Deepak C Shetty <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Mar 30 06:46:37 2015 +0000

    libvirt: Use 'relative' flag for online snapshot's commit/rebase operations
    
    libvirt added support for _RELATIVE flag in v1.2.7 and when available this
    flag _must_ be used to ensure backing paths are maintained relative during
    snapshot delete operations.
    
    This patch uses _RELATIVE flag if available, for both blockCommit and
    blockRebase cases for both file and network backed disks.
    
    If _RELATIVE flag is unavailable, it raises excp for blockCommit case
    (since we can't get relative paths and Cinder flow is broken), but only
    puts out a warning message for blockRebase case (since relative paths
    works even for older libvirt)
    
    Closes-Bug: 1438027
    Change-Id: I9bda95cd4ab09aed88536d4a988d6c6579441c37
